metadata.Title: CVE-2023-2898 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - low.
metadata.Description:
There is a null-pointer-dereference flaw found in f2fs_write_end_io in fs/f2fs/data.c in the Linux kernel. This flaw allows a local privileged user to cause a denial of service problem. It was discovered that a race condition existed in the f2fs file system in the Linux kernel, leading to a null pointer dereference vulnerability. An attacker could use this to construct a malicious f2fs image that, when mounted and operated on, could cause a denial of service (system crash).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-2898` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.2.0-32-generic - 6.2.0-32.32
linux-image-6.2.0-32-generic-lpae - 6.2.0-32.32
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-32-generic - 6.2.0-32.32
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-32-generic-64k - 6.2.0-32.32
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1011-aws - 6.2.0-1011.11
No subscription required

No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> proposed patch is "f2fs: fix to avoid NULL pointer dereference f2fs_write_end_io()"

criterions.comment: linux package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-32.32').
linux-allwinner: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life, was needs-triage').
linux-aws package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1011.11').
